snippet: Missing another deadline, the government failed to reach agreement with creditors Tuesday, and Greek workers walked off the job to protest austerity measures.
abstract: Greek political leaders again postpone decision on an austerity package in exchange for the billions in loans Athens needs to prevent an impending default; thousands of Greeks have walked off the job in a general strike to protest the measures, which include 20-percent cuts to base pay for workers in private companies and a loosening of public sector job protections; elected officials feel that passage of measures amounts to political suicide, with elections looming as soon as April.
lead_paragraph: Missing another deadline, the government failed to reach agreement with creditors Tuesday, and Greek workers walked off the job to protest austerity measures.

headline.seo: Greece Puts Off Austerity Talks Amid Strike
headline.main: Greece Puts Off Decision on Austerity Moves Amid a Strike Protesting Them
headline.print_headline: Greece Puts Off Decision on Austerity Moves Amid a Strike Protesting Them
